intro: Grevea madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar grevea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy yellow flowers with a distinctive red calyx, which bloom during the dry season. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
